newsitem.title: USA: Summit wins patent judgements in Germany.
newsitem.headline: Summit wins patent judgements in Germany.

text.p: Summit Technology Inc., which makes laser devices for treating vision problems, said Thursday that a private German company agreed to pay it 1.23 million German marks ($800,000) in satisfaction of a judgment Summit won in a patent-infringement suit.
Summit said Herbert Schwind GmbH & Co. agreed to the payment after Summit won a judgment in Germany that Schwind's Keratom ophthalmic excimer laser system infringed Summit's "Azema" patent.

The company, based in Waltham, Mass., said it also obtained a separate judgment in Germany against Chiron Technolas for infringement of the same patent. No financial details were announced regarding that action.
Summit's stock gained 37.5 cents to $5.75 in afternoon trading on the Nasdaq market.
